p: Essential oils from S. officinalis (sage), S. hortensis (summer savory), and A. graveolens (dill) were obtained by hydrodistillation and further characterized by gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (GC-MS). In the case of S. officinalis, the GC-MS analysis led to the identification of 18 components, the major ones being Î±-thujone and camphor, with comparable percentages (25.778% and 26.316%, respectively). The results of the chromatographic analysis and the cumulative composition are given in Table S1.
